title: How to Make a Sprocket Chandelier

steps.headline: Get a nail and hammer to remove the middle portion of the flywheel.
steps.description: Hit the nail with the hammer until the bearing separates from the flywheel.

steps.headline: Insert the wires into a shower curtain rod.
Feed the wire into the rod until you reach the end of the wire.
Tie the wire into a knot.
Have an electrician connect the wires into a power source.
Place the sprocket or flywheel on top of the pendant light.
Screw a 40 watt bulb into the socket.
Mount your chandelier to the ceiling.

text: Obtain your sprockets. Clean them. Get a nail and hammer to remove the middle portion of the flywheel. Hit the nail with the hammer until the bearing separates from the flywheel. Discard the bearings.  Get a pendant light set.  Insert the wires into a shower curtain rod.  Feed the wire into the rod until you reach the end of the wire.  Tie the wire into a knot.  Have an electrician connect the wires into a power source.  Place the sprocket or flywheel on top of the pendant light.  Screw a 40 watt bulb into the socket.  Mount your chandelier to the ceiling.  Enjoy your bike inspired chandelier.
